reference: Mathematical Programming for Economic Analysis in Agriculture
math_formula:
Maximize farm earnings: $$
\text{Maximize} \quad \sum_{c \in C} Price_c \cdot Sales_c - \text{AnnualWageRateFamilyLabor} \cdot \text{FamilyLaborAvailable} - \text{AnnualWageRatePermanentLabor} \cdot \text{PermanentLaborHired} - \text{HourlyWageRateTemporaryLabor} \cdot \sum_{t \in T} \text{TemporaryLaborHired}_t - \text{PriceOfWater} \cdot \sum_{t \in T, c \in C} \text{WaterRequirement}_{t,c} \cdot \text{AmountPlanted}_c
$$

Constraints:
1. Land Limitations: $$
\sum_{c \in C} \text{FractionOccupiesLand}_{t,c} \cdot \text{AmountPlanted}_c \leq \text{LandAvailable} \quad \forall t \in T
$$
2. Labor Requirements: $$
\sum_{c \in C} \text{LaborRequired}_{t,c} \cdot \text{AmountPlanted}_c \leq \text{WorkingHours}_t \cdot (\text{FamilyLaborAvailable} + \text{PermanentLaborHired}) + \text{TemporaryLaborHired}_t \quad \forall t \in T
$$
3. Water Requirements 1: $$
\sum_{c \in C} \text{WaterRequirement}_{t,c} \cdot \text{AmountPlanted}_c \leq \text{WaterLimit}_t \quad \forall t \in T
$$
4. Water Requirements 2: $$
\sum_{t \in T, c \in C} \text{WaterRequirement}_{t,c} \cdot \text{AmountPlanted}_c \leq \text{AnnualAmountOfWaterAvailable}
$$
5. Family Consumption 1: $$
\text{Yield}_c \cdot \text{AmountPlanted}_c = \sum_{b \in B} \text{AmountInBundle}_{c,b} \cdot \text{FractionConsumed}_b + \text{Sales}_c \quad \forall c \in C
$$
6. Family Consumption 2: $$
\sum_{b \in B} \text{FractionConsumed}_b = 1
$$
natural_language_example: A farmer wants to maximize earnings by planning the optimal allocation of crops, labor, and water resources. The farm has 100 hectares of land, 12 months of planning, and 2 consumption bundles. Each crop has a specific yield, price, labor requirement, and water requirement. The farmer must ensure that the total land used does not exceed the available land, labor requirements are met, and water usage stays within monthly and annual limits. Additionally, the farmer must allocate a portion of the crops for family consumption while selling the rest to maximize earnings.
